newsitem.title: RUSSIA: NATO's Solana to spend holiday in Russia.
newsitem.headline: NATO's Solana to spend holiday in Russia.

text.p: NATO Secretary General Javier Solana will arrive in Moscow on Sunday at the invitation of the Kremlin to spend a week's holiday in Russia with his family, a Foreign Ministry spokesman said on Friday.
Valery Nesterushkin told Reuters that Solana had expressed a desire to visit Moscow, St Petersburg and old Russian towns.

The former Spanish foreign minister, who thrashed out a difficult NATO pact with Moscow this year in the face of bitter Russian opposition to the alliance's expansion into eastern Europe, may have unofficial meetings with some politicians during his stay.
Interfax news agency said Solana would meet First Deputy Prime Minister Boris Nemtsov on Monday.
